answerText: Stephen Crane[10] That aforementioned poetry collection by Stephen Crane is this one. It gets its name from a poem that describes the "clang and clang of spear and shield" and "clash and clash of hoof and heel" of the title beings who came from the sea.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | Finals 1 | 16 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One of his collections describes a creature "who, squatting upon the ground, held his heart in his hand, and ate of it." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poet, who also wrote novels like The Red Badge of Courage and Maggie: A Girl of the Streets.
